title: spack test doesn't warn you about non-existing tests
body:
If you can't remember the name of a test (is it `build_system_guesser` or `build_system_guess`?) and try running it, `spack test` won't warn you that the test doesn't exist:
```
$ spack test foo
==================================================================== test session starts =====================================================================
platform darwin -- Python 2.7.12, pytest-3.0.5, py-1.4.32, pluggy-0.4.0
rootdir: /Users/Adam/spack, inifile: pytest.ini
collected 496 items 

==================================================================== 496 tests deselected ====================================================================
=============================================================== 496 deselected in 0.46 seconds ===============================================================
```
It would be nice if we checked whether or not the test actually existed. If it doesn't, we should print an error message and tell them to run `spack test --list`, or just run it for them.

@alalazo
